item.title: 高盛认为加州野火对美国就业的拖累 "不大
item.description: 据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Deadly wildfires in Los Angeles County will likely result in only a “modest drag” on US jobs growth, even as the blazes shape as one of the costliest natural disasters in US history, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 大火肆虐的洛杉矶准备应对更强的狂风
item.description: 南加州面临着将于周一晚间开始的新一轮危险的火灾天气，即使工作人员正在努力控制风力造成的大火，大火已造成洛杉矶瘫痪近一周，并导致至少 24 人死亡。【原文：Southern California faces another round of dangerous fire weather set to begin Monday night, even as crews struggle to contain wind-driven blazes that have paralyzed Los Angeles for nearly a week and killed at least 24 people.】

item.title: 智利在推进补贴法案时回避可再生能源利润掠夺问题
item.description: 智利下议院批准了一项扩大对低收入家庭电力补贴的法案，但取消了一项通过限制可再生能源行业利润来筹集部分所需资金的措施。【原文：Chile’s lower house approved a bill to expand electricity subsidies for lower-income families after stripping out a measure that would have raised part of the funds required by curbing profits in a segment of the renewable energy industry.】

item.title: 俄罗斯扩大对几十年来最大黑海灾难的应对范围
item.description: 在克里姆林宫继续评估这场灾难的全面规模之际，俄罗斯成立了一个新的政府委员会，负责协调清理黑海近代史上最大的石油产品泄漏事件。【原文：Russia has formed a new government commission to coordinate clean up of the biggest spill of oil products in the Black Sea in recent history as the Kremlin continues to assess the full scale of the catastrophe.】

item.title: 冰岛报告最大冰川爆发洪水
item.description: 据冰岛气象局称，冰岛最活跃的火山之一瓦特纳若库尔（Vatnajokull）冰川下已经开始爆发冰川洪水。【原文：A glacial outburst flood has started from underneath Iceland’s Vatnajokull glacier, the site of one of the country’s most active volcanoes, according to its Met Office.】

item.title: 这些房屋经受住了洛杉矶大火的考验。建筑师解释原因
item.description:
在太平洋帕利塞兹和马里布，一些采用防火设计的房屋在一片废墟中依然屹立不倒。【原文：

In Pacific Palisades and Malibu, some houses with fire-resistant designs remained standing amid neighborhoods of destruction. 

】

item.title: 石油行业在夏威夷气候诉讼案上遭最高法院唾弃
item.description: 美国最高法院支持环保倡导者要求石油公司对气候变化负责的努力，允许火奴鲁鲁提起诉讼，指控石油公司在化石燃料带来的风险方面欺骗客户。【原文：The US Supreme Court buttressed efforts by environmental advocates to hold oil companies accountable for climate change, letting Honolulu press a lawsuit that accuses the industry of deceiving customers about the risks posed by fossil fuels.】

item.title: 风能预测下调，德国和英国电价上涨
item.description: 由于风力发电量的预测被下调，加上寒冷天气刺激了供暖需求，欧洲电力价格跳涨。【原文：European power prices jumped as a forecast for wind generation was revised downward and cold weather boosted heating demand.】

item.title: 日本西南部发生 6.9 级地震
item.description: 东京（美联社）— 周一，日本西南部发生了初步震级为 6.9 级的强烈地震，引发了远离沿海地区的公众警告，因为海啸警报随后被取消。【原文：TOKYO (AP) — A strong earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.9 hit southwestern Japan on Monday, triggering public warnings to stay away from coastal areas because of a tsunami advisory, which was later called off.】

item.title: 洛杉矶为第二周的风火风暴做好准备
item.description: 洛杉矶和南加州其他地区面临着第二周的狂风，狂风将野火变成了喷灯，危及生命，摧毁房屋、商业和文化地标。【原文：Los Angeles and the rest of Southern California face a second week of fierce winds that are turning wildfires into blowtorches, putting lives at risk and destroying homes, business and cultural landmarks.】

item.title: 德国极右翼与特朗普在风能拆解问题上保持一致
item.description: 德国极右翼政党 AfD 警告称，如果赢得执政，将拆除风力发电厂，这引发了德国能源行业的强烈反应。【原文：Germany’s far-right AfD party warned it would dismantle wind parks should it win power, triggering a scathing response from the country’s energy industry.】

item.title: 推动液化天然气发展的绿色大潮
item.description: 洛杉矶大火仍在继续肆虐。预计本周初至少会有两轮凶猛干燥的圣安娜风吹过南加州，带来强劲的阵风，这将给努力控制两处毁灭性大火的消防人员带来挑战，并可能迫使成千上万的居民撤离。点击此处了解最新消息。【原文：The Los Angeles fires are continuing to rage. At least two rounds of vicious, dry Santa Ana winds are expected to blast through Southern California early this week, bringing powerful gusts that will challenge fire crews struggling to contain two destructive blazes and likely force thousands more residents to evacuate. Keep up with the latest news here.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚大胆推进绿色发展的意外代价：天然气进口
item.description:
安第斯国家必须引进碳足迹更大的货物，因为其自身的储量正在减少，而且其总统拒绝允许签订新的钻探合同。【原文：

The Andean nation must bring in cargoes with a bigger carbon footprint as its own reserves dwindle and its president refuses to allow new drilling contracts.

】

item.title: 西欧各地的冰冻天气将推高供暖需求
item.description: 西欧各地的冰冻气温将推动本周的供暖需求上升，天气前景将比之前的预测更加寒冷。【原文：Freezing temperatures across western Europe will drive up heating demand this week, with the weather outlook turning colder than previous forecasts.】

item.title: 中国太阳能巨头获准在四川建设硅片厂
item.description: 随着供应紧张和下游需求提振国内价格，中国两家大型太阳能制造商已获四川地方政府批准，在该省西南部建设硅晶片工厂。【原文：Two major Chinese solar manufacturers have been approved by the local government of Sichuan to build silicon wafer plants in the southwestern province, as tight supply and downstream demand boost domestic prices.】

item.title: 人人自危：洛杉矶为新一周的野火做好准备
item.description: 随着洛杉矶野火的肆虐，数百万居民正准备迎接更多焦虑的日子，他们将重要文件和不可替代的纪念品装入行囊，准备迎接撤离命令。【原文：As the Los Angeles wildfires rage on, millions of residents are preparing for more days of anxiety, packing go-bags with vital documents and irreplaceable mementos as they brace for evacuation orders.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火肆虐，强风本周将卷土重来
item.description: 预计本周初至少会有两轮凶猛、干燥的圣安娜风吹过南加州，带来强劲的阵风，这将给努力控制两场毁灭性大火的消防人员带来挑战，并可能迫使成千上万的居民撤离。【原文：At least two rounds of vicious, dry Santa Ana winds are expected to blast through Southern California early this week, bringing powerful gusts that will challenge fire crews struggling to contain two destructive blazes and likely force thousands more residents to evacuate.】

item.title: 大风持续，洛杉矶野火灾情几乎没有缓解
item.description: 干燥的热风将使洛杉矶的大火蔓延至本周中旬，而且一些预测显示，本月余下时间的情况也不会有所缓解。【原文：Dry, hot winds will fan blazes in Los Angeles into midweek — and some forecasts show little relief for the rest of the month — as Southern California struggles with one of the worst starts to a year for wildfires.】

item.title: 墨尔本遭受山洪和冰雹袭击，澳大利亚网球公开赛被迫中断
item.description: 强风、冰雹和瓢泼大雨扰乱了墨尔本的交通和活动，包括一年一度的澳大利亚网球公开赛。【原文：Melbourne suffered flash flooding as powerful winds, hail and driving rain disrupted transport and activities in the city, including the annual Australian Open tennis tournament.】

item.title: 大火威胁更多社区：洛杉矶灾难图片
item.description:
预计干燥的大风将持续到下周的前半周，数百万人将面临危险

。【原文：

With high, dry winds forecast to continue through the first half of the coming week, millions are left in peril

】

item.title: 天气将加剧洛杉矶火灾的风险
item.description: 在短暂的喘息之后，天气将再次对洛杉矶不利，这让消防员们得以在美国人口第二大城市的大火中取得进展，并为官员们开始相互指责提供了足够的喘息机会。【原文：The weather will once again turn against Los Angeles after a brief respite that allowed firefighters to gain ground on blazes across the second-most populous US city and offered enough pause for officials to begin trading accusations.】

item.title: 洛杉矶面临保险末日
item.description: 洛杉矶地区的大火仍在燃烧。虽然紧急救援队周五终于在大火中取得了进展，但官员们现在却在相互指责，称市政府自己的行为使灾难变得更加严重。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读最新消息以及我们对火灾的所有报道。【原文：The fires continue to burn across the Los Angeles area. While emergency teams finally gained ground on the blazes Friday, officials are now trading accusations that the city’s own actions have made the catastrophe worse. You can read the latest updates and all of our coverage on the fires on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 寒流持续，英国气温一夜降至零下 18.7 摄氏度
item.description: 在英国 15 年来最寒冷的一月夜晚，气温降至零下 18.7 摄氏度，寒风凛冽的天气仍在继续。【原文：Temperatures dropped to minus 18.7C in the UK's coldest January night in 15 years, as the wintry weather continues.】

item.title: 寒流持续，苏格兰小镇气温降至零下 18 摄氏度
item.description: 一夜之间，气温再次下降，苏格兰北部的一个小村庄在零下 18 摄氏度的低温中瑟瑟发抖。【原文：The mercury fell again overnight with a hamlet in northern Scotland shivering through a temperature of minus 18C.】

item.title: 消防机构将调查爱迪生公司与洛杉矶赫斯特火灾的可能联系
item.description: 爱迪生国际南加州公用事业公司表示，消防机构正在调查该公司的设备是否参与了圣费尔南多附近赫斯特大火的引燃。【原文：Edison International’s Southern California utility said fire agencies are investigating whether the company’s equipment was involved in the ignition of the Hurst Fire near San Fernando.】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火将脆弱的加州保险市场推向极限
item.description:
随着大火的肆虐，这场灾难有可能打破加州气候风险与房屋保险之间脆弱的平衡。【原文：

As the fires rage on, the disaster threatens to upend the fragile balance between climate risk and home insurance in California.

】

item.title: 纽瑟姆下令调查洛杉矶野火期间消防栓干涸原因
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）在消防栓干涸后下令对管理该市供水系统的洛杉矶机构进行州级调查，这妨碍了保护家园免遭致命野火的努力。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom ordered a state investigation of the Los Angeles agencies running the city’s water systems after fire hydrants ran dry, hampering efforts to protect homes from deadly wildfires.】

item.title: 洛杉矶消防员正得到加拿大水弹飞机的援助
item.description:
30年来，这些飞机一直是加利福尼亚州防火系统的一部分。在气候变暖的世界中，此类跨境交易将变得更加重要。【原文：

For 30 years, the aircraft have been part of California's fire defenses. In a warming world, these types of cross-border deals will become more important.

】

item.title: 在有史以来最热的一年里，美国家庭使用了创纪录的电力来降温
item.description:
虽然人工智能在能源使用方面备受关注，但住宅领域的耗电量却远远超过其他领域，而且随着地球升温，耗电量还将增加。【原文：

While artificial intelligence has attracted scrutiny for energy use, the residential sector is far and away the biggest power suck — and it’s set to grow as the planet heats up.

】
